1.EXPLANATION: Lock on the enemy in front of you. <Color:255,255,150,255>When you are holding items such as spray cans or lighters, it will allow you to use them as weapons. <Color:Default>

2.EXPLANATION:
Grab enemy in front of you to prevent movement.
Some enemies can immediately escape your grasp. Press <Action:Battle_Guard@Combat> to grab from the other side.

3.EXPLANATION: Grab the legs of a fallen enemy. A variety of other moves can be performed from that point.
3.CONTROL_EXPLANATION: Press <Action:Battle_Drop_Weapon@Combat> when you are near an fallen enemy.

4.EXPLANATION: Pick up weapons showing the <Sign:23> icon. Press <Action:Battle_Drop_Weapon@Combat> in order to throw it.

5.EXPLANATION: Guard against attacks from the front. Does not work against knives or guns.

6.EXPLANATION: Guard against attacks from the front. Can also be used to guard weapon attacks. Some weapons can block bullets.

7.EXPLANATION: Evade attacks with agile footwork. You can step forward, backwards, left, or right.

8.EXPLANATION: Taunt your enemy. Certain ability upgrades improve your taunts.
8.CONTROL_EXPLANATION: <Action:Battle_Extreme_Heat@Combat> when unarmed and facing nearby enemy

9.EXPLANATION: Move the camera up, down, left, or right. Change the controls in Settings from the Pause Menu.

10.EXPLANATION: Set the camera behind the character.

11.EXPLANATION: Smoke in front of enemies to show them who's boss.

12.EXPLANATION: Perform a combo that can lead to a variety of other attacks.

13.EXPLANATION: This powerful finisher after a Rush Combo sends your enemy flying.

14.EXPLANATION: Attack without entering Fighting Stance to hit enemies at your sides and rear.

15.EXPLANATION: Attack with a front kick. This attack may change alongside walls and on stairs.

16.EXPLANATION: Punch your enemy after grabbing them. You can unleash a combo or send your enemy flying.

17.EXPLANATION: Throw an enemy after grabbing them. Use this attack to hurl an enemy into his comrades.

18.EXPLANATION: Take out an equipped weapon. Change weapons by selecting Items from the Pause Menu.

19.EXPLANATION: Pick up and throw weapons at enemies. The impact differs based on the weapon.

20.EXPLANATION: Pull a fallen enemy up off the ground and mercilessly slam him back down. Time is money. <Color:255,255,150,255>Available after you acquire Pull Up Enemy.<Color:Default>
20.CONTROL_EXPLANATION: <Action:Battle_Heavy_Attack@Combat> <Color:109,193,240,255>after pulling up a knocked down enemy lying face up<Color:Default>

21.EXPLANATION: Callously hurl your enemy from dangerous heights. Can also be performed near rivers and similar locations.
21.CONTROL_EXPLANATION: <Color:109,193,240,255>Grab near high place or water, then<Color:Default> <Action:Battle_Heavy_Attack@Combat>

22.EXPLANATION: Smash an opponent against a wall. Grows more deadly the more you use it.

23.EXPLANATION: Crush an opponent from behind. Takes a bit of finesse to pull off.
23.CONTROL_EXPLANATION: <Color:109,193,240,255>Grab enemy from behind near a wall, then<Color:Default> <Action:Battle_Heavy_Attack@Combat>

24.EXPLANATION: Fling your opponent into a chain-link fence, and then fling yourself into your opponent.

25.EXPLANATION: Smash an opponent against a fence and grate their head with it. Take a little off the top.
25.CONTROL_EXPLANATION: <Color:109,193,240,255>Grab from back near metal fence, then<Color:Default> <Action:Battle_Heavy_Attack@Combat>

26.EXPLANATION: Slam your enemy's head into a raised surface, then deliver a vicious blow.

27.EXPLANATION: Perform a shoulder throw while grabbing the back of your enemy's neck, then smash his head against a low surface.

28.EXPLANATION: Elegantly grab a pole and use that momentum to crash down on an enemy.

29.EXPLANATION: Use a guard rail or fence to deliver a vicious blow to your enemy's backside.
29.CONTROL_EXPLANATION: <Color:109,193,240,255>Grab enemy at end of rail/fence, then<Color:Default> <Action:Battle_Heavy_Attack@Combat>

30.EXPLANATION: Drop an opponent on a protruding object. It's a real brain buster.

31.EXPLANATION: Repeatedly pummel the enemy while he's on his back.

32.EXPLANATION: Deliver a vicious punch to the face of a fallen enemy.

33.EXPLANATION: Take out two birds with one stone by dropping one enemy onto another who's lying on the ground.
33.CONTROL_EXPLANATION: <Color:109,193,240,255>Grab enemy near a fallen enemy, then<Color:Default> <Action:Battle_Heavy_Attack@Combat>

34.EXPLANATION: Viciously stomp on a fallen enemy. <Color:255,255,150,255>Only possible with weapons without a unique finishing move.<Color:Default>
34.CONTROL_EXPLANATION: <Action:Battle_Heavy_Attack@Combat> <Color:109,193,240,255>when armed and enemy falls face up<Color:Default>

35.EXPLANATION: Viciously kick a fallen enemy. <Color:255,255,150,255>Only possible with weapons without a unique finishing move.<Color:Default>
35.CONTROL_EXPLANATION: <Action:Battle_Heavy_Attack@Combat> <Color:109,193,240,255>when armed and enemy falls face down<Color:Default>

36.EXPLANATION: Bring the hammer down on your foe. Literally.

37.EXPLANATION: A simple and popular attack. Throw an object onto a downed enemy, putting the force of your body and soul behind it.

38.EXPLANATION: A devastating attack. Just when the enemy thinks you're finished, come down upon them with all your might.

39.EXPLANATION: Force something on an opponent's head and spin it. Then break them with a knifehand strike as though they were a pile of bricks.

40.EXPLANATION: Rattle an enemy's brains with a blow to the head, then finish him with a final blow.

41.EXPLANATION: Slam the enemy with a signboard, then come down on it with all your weight.

42.EXPLANATION: Pummel an enemy with a one-handed weapon, then deliver one mighty blow.

43.EXPLANATION: Drop something heavy on an enemy's head. Sometimes simple is best.

44.EXPLANATION: A basic attack passed down through the Lotus School. Trips the opponent, and then deals additional attacks.

45.EXPLANATION: Use your Kali Sticks to rain blow after blow upon your opponent, rendering them helpless.

46.EXPLANATION: An ancient sword technique. Epitomizes the ferocity of a unique double-bladed style.

47.EXPLANATION: An ancient sword technique. Charge forward like a powerful bull.

48.EXPLANATION: Combine an ancient sword technique with the weight of a hammer. Swat down your foes as though they were but flies.

49.EXPLANATION: Use the weight of the hammer to pound enemies into the ground with a series of powerful blows.

50.EXPLANATION: This ancient sword technique is reminiscent of a wolf's swift and accurate strike.

51.EXPLANATION: Pin your opponent's hand to the wall with a dagger.

52.EXPLANATION: Charge an enemy with a short-bladed weapon and use your momentum to deliver a punishing strike.

53.EXPLANATION: A graceful, majestic strike that uses nunchaku to their utmost potential.

54.EXPLANATION: Take a mighty swing that sends your enemy flying.

55.EXPLANATION: An attack utilizing basic tonfa techniques.

56.EXPLANATION: Force a mystery liquid down an enemy's throat. Does more psychological damage than physical... Probably.

57.EXPLANATION: Shove the enemy away, then deliver three sword slashes.

58.EXPLANATION: Charge your stun gun with electrified passion, powering it up beyond its physical limits. Transcends modern understanding of physics.

59.EXPLANATION: Get a strike on your opponent's shins and bowl them into the gutter. Spare no mercy.

60.EXPLANATION: Rub salt into an enemy's eyes. Show your enemies what it truly means to be salty. Even works on those wearing glasses!

61.EXPLANATION: Inject a mysterious syringe into an opponent's posterior. Hopefully it isn't too dangerous.

62.EXPLANATION: Send an opponent flying down range. Not a fair way to play, but a nice shot nonetheless.

63.EXPLANATION: Grill an enemy's face with a gas burner. As simple as throwing a pie, and more painful than you can imagine.

64.EXPLANATION: Give your opponent a free tooth extraction or manicure, street style.

65.EXPLANATION: Use an umbrella's hooked handle to reel an enemy in and then cast them out.

66.EXPLANATION: Grab your opponent by the feet and ruthlessly plow them into a surface.

67.EXPLANATION: Show your devilish side by picking up an enemy and swinging them into a wall.

68.EXPLANATION: Pick up a foe and swing them into a pole. Maybe catching a glimpse of heaven will help them realize the error of their ways.

69.EXPLANATION: Swing a foe around and use them as a weapon. Those involved catch a glimpse into hell.

70.EXPLANATION: Grab an opponent and smash them into the ground. Put all your strength, spirit, and weight into a single devastating blow!

71.EXPLANATION: Surprise an opponent while you're knocked down by breaking their shins

72.EXPLANATION: A secret street fighting technique. Skillfully use a lit cigarette to create an opening.

73.EXPLANATION: Strike down your opponents with frightful speed.

74.EXPLANATION: Work with an ally to deliver a vicious blow.
74.CONTROL_EXPLANATION: <Action:Battle_Heavy_Attack@Combat> <Color:109,193,240,255>when ally is holding enemy from back<Color:Default>

75.EXPLANATION: After an ally smashes the back of your opponent's head into the ground with a powerbomb, cave in their face with a stomp.
75.CONTROL_EXPLANATION: <Action:Battle_Heavy_Attack@Combat> <Color:109,193,240,255>when ally is holding enemy from front<Color:Default>

76.EXPLANATION: Knee and headbutt a rising opponent to break his nose.
76.CONTROL_EXPLANATION: <Action:Battle_Heavy_Attack@Combat> <Color:109,193,240,255>when enemy is trying to get up<Color:Default>

77.EXPLANATION: Ram a bike into your enemy putting all your weight behind it.

78.EXPLANATION: Glue two enemies together with superglue, then watch them struggle before viciously tearing them apart.

79.EXPLANATION: Launch a skyrocket at your enemy.

80.EXPLANATION: Unleash after Dragon Spirit to mow down surrounding enemies all at once.

81.EXPLANATION: Attack an enemy calling for backup, then smash his phone. No one's coming to save him now.
81.CONTROL_EXPLANATION: <Action:Battle_Heavy_Attack@Combat> <Color:109,193,240,255>when enemy tries to call for backup<Color:Default>

82.EXPLANATION: Build up power before delivering a savage kick. <Color:255,255,150,255>Only possible when the Climax Heat Gauge is full.<Color:Default>

83.EXPLANATION: Taunt enemies with the spirit of the white tiger to boost morale and increase your Heat Gauge.

84.EXPLANATION: Block enemy attacks with the spirit of the black tortoise to increase your Heat Gauge.

85.EXPLANATION: Earn more experience points when finishing off enemies with Heat Actions.

86.EXPLANATION: You will be less likely to recoil from enemy attacks while in Heat Mode.

87.EXPLANATION: The phoenix's spirit automatically fills up the Heat Gauge if your Health Gauge is flashing red.

88.EXPLANATION: Stay alive while in Heat Mode with the tireless strength of the azure dragon.

89.EXPLANATION: Guard against bladed weapons and bullets with your bare hands while in Heat Mode.

90.EXPLANATION: Recover health slightly using the Heat Gauge while in Heat Mode.

91.EXPLANATION: Heat Gauge rises slightly when landing an attack on an enemy even while Dragon Spirit is in effect.

92.EXPLANATION: Press the button at the right time to break your enemy's guard with the next attack of your combo.

98.EXPLANATION: A devastating strike executed after a Finishing Blow.

99.EXPLANATION: Leap in the air to deliver a powerful two-legged kick.

100.EXPLANATION: Swiftly regain your guard if it has been broken.

101.EXPLANATION: Allows you to the break an enemy's guard with certain attacks.

102.EXPLANATION: Knock enemies down by kicking the legs out from under them while rising to your feet.

103.EXPLANATION: Force a downed enemy onto his feet.
103.CONTROL_EXPLANATION: <Action:Battle_Drop_Weapon@Combat> when next to head of downed enemy

104.EXPLANATION: Regain your footing when you are about to get knocked down, then perform a counterattack.
104.CONTROL_EXPLANATION: <Action:Battle_Heavy_Attack@Combat> right before you are knocked down

105.EXPLANATION: Throw your enemy after unleashing a Finishing Blow.

106.EXPLANATION: Throw an enemy who has grabbed on to you.

107.EXPLANATION: Evade danger by performing Quickstep right after an attack. This will lower your Heat Gauge.

115.EXPLANATION: Get back on your feet faster after getting knocked down.

117.EXPLANATION: Throw enemies you grab with greater ease.

118.EXPLANATION: Do more damage to surrounding enemies when hitting them with thrown enemies.

119.EXPLANATION: Pull off an impressive dodge by rolling after Quickstep.

120.EXPLANATION: Extend the time you are invulnerable during Quickstep.

121.EXPLANATION: Regain your footing to avoid getting knocked down.

123.EXPLANATION: Avoid recoiling from attacks during your combo by entering your next combo at the right time.

128.EXPLANATION: Deliver a vicious attack to a fallen enemy. Acquire new finishing moves the more you use it.

129.EXPLANATION: Boost the Heat Gauge's maximum value.

130.EXPLANATION: Show an enemy grabbing you that they should keep their hands to themselves by piledriving them.

131.EXPLANATION: Boost the Heat Gauge's maximum value.

132.EXPLANATION: Deal massive damage to an enemy by grating his face against the ground.

133.EXPLANATION: Deliver a vicious strike, then steal your enemy's weapon. Does not work against certain weapons.

134.EXPLANATION: Deliver a vicious attack by using an enemy's own large weapon against him.

135.EXPLANATION: Perform a powerful counter move against an enemy's attack. The move differs by direction.

136.EXPLANATION: Stop enemies with firearms from shooting, then deliver a vicious strike.

137.EXPLANATION: Deliver a powerful counterattack against an enemy's sword attack.

138.EXPLANATION: Boost the amount the Heat Gauge rises when attacking.

139.EXPLANATION: Boost the Heat Gauge's maximum value.

143.EXPLANATION: Unleash pent up rage to deliver powerful combos or throws for a short time.

144.EXPLANATION: Knock back your enemy while you are guarding creating a chance for a counterattack.

145.EXPLANATION: Evade enemy attacks with Quickstep while attacking at the same time.

146.EXPLANATION: Neutralize an enemy attack by parrying it, then knock your enemy out. Some enemies can't be knocked out.
146.CONTROL_EXPLANATION: <Action:Battle_Drop_Weapon@Combat> in Fighting Stance before attack hits

147.EXPLANATION: Deliver a vicious counterattack while your enemy is attacking.
147.CONTROL_EXPLANATION: <Action:Battle_Heavy_Attack@Combat> in Fighting Stance before attack hits

148.EXPLANATION: Improve the odds of Komaki Tiger Drop working by learning to better judge when enemies will attack.

149.EXPLANATION: Thrust your body into your enemy for major damage. <Color:255,255,150,255>Only possible when the Climax Heat Gauge is full.<Color:Default>

150.EXPLANATION: Perform the ultimate reversal move while at death's door. <Color:255,255,150,255>Only possible when the Climax Heat Gauge is full.<Color:Default>

151.EXPLANATION: A brutal attack in which you slam your enemy's head in a car door with all your might.
151.CONTROL_EXPLANATION: <Color:109,193,240,255>Grab enemy next to black taxi, then<Color:Default> <Action:Battle_Heavy_Attack@Combat>

152.EXPLANATION: Master the use of garbage cans to immobilize enemies by flipping them over their heads and into the trash.

153.EXPLANATION: Master the art of jamming lit stoves into enemy faces.

154.EXPLANATION: Master the use of pliers to tear the side of your enemy's face to shreds.

155.EXPLANATION: Unlock the second level of health and use food to boost different abilities.

156.EXPLANATION: Boost Strength, Focus, and Fighting Spirit to the second level to achieve greater bonuses.

157.EXPLANATION: Lower the rate at which the second level of health automatically declines.

158.EXPLANATION: Boost the Heat Gauge's maximum value.

159.EXPLANATION: Boost the Heat Gauge's maximum value.

160.EXPLANATION: Boost the amount the Heat Gauge rises when attacking.

285.EXPLANATION: Deliver a devastating blow with a giant piece of equipment ripped out of the ground.

286.EXPLANATION: Lift up an enemy who bounced back from a wall, then ram him into it again full force.

287.EXPLANATION: Deliver a vicious strike, then steal your enemy's weapon. Does not work against certain weapons.

288.EXPLANATION: Catch your opponents on guard! Sweep out the feet of guarding enemies to watch them crumble.

289.EXPLANATION: Boost the amount the Heat Gauge rises when attacking.

290.EXPLANATION: Boost the Heat Gauge's maximum value.

295.EXPLANATION: Grab a fallen enemy and swing him around like a weapon, striking other enemies all around.

296.EXPLANATION: Rip equipment or a road sign out of the ground, then use it as a devastating weapon.

297.EXPLANATION: Knock back your enemy while you are guarding creating a chance for a counterattack.

298.EXPLANATION: Lift up an enemy you have grabbed, then slam him down. <Color:255,255,150,255>Only possible when the Climax Heat Gauge is full.<Color:Default>

299.EXPLANATION: Never flinch from enemy attacks as long as you are in Heat Mode.

300.EXPLANATION: Deliver a vicious counterattack while your enemy is attacking.
300.CONTROL_EXPLANATION: <Action:Battle_Heavy_Attack@Combat> in Fighting Stance before attack hits

301.EXPLANATION: Charge forward and send your enemy flying. <Color:255,255,150,255>Only possible when the Climax Heat Gauge is full.<Color:Default>

302.EXPLANATION: Violently roll your enemy in the snow, turning him into a human snowman.

303.EXPLANATION: Master the use of garbage cans to immobilize enemies by flipping them over their heads and into the trash.

304.EXPLANATION: Smash a potted plant over an enemy's head. An eco-friendly takedown.

305.EXPLANATION: Disable an enemy with your mastery of the bicycle tire.

306.EXPLANATION: Unlock the second level of health and use food to boost different abilities.

307.EXPLANATION: Boost Strength, Focus, and Fighting Spirit to the second level to achieve greater bonuses.

308.EXPLANATION: Lower the rate at which the second level of health automatically declines.

309.EXPLANATION: Boost the Heat Gauge's maximum value.

310.EXPLANATION: Boost the Heat Gauge's maximum value.

311.EXPLANATION: Boost the amount the Heat Gauge rises when attacking.

313.EXPLANATION: Lock on the enemy in front of you. <Color:255,255,150,255>When you are holding items such as spray cans or lighters, it will allow you to use them as weapons. <Color:Default>

314.EXPLANATION:
Grab enemy in front of you to prevent movement.
Some enemies can immediately escape your grasp. Press <Action:Battle_Guard@Combat> to grab from the other side.

315.EXPLANATION: Pick up weapons showing the <Sign:23> icon. Press <Action:Battle_Drop_Weapon@Combat> in order to throw it.

316.EXPLANATION: Guard against attacks from the front. Does not work against knives or guns.

317.EXPLANATION: Guard against attacks from the front. Can also be used to guard weapon attacks. Some weapons can block bullets.

318.EXPLANATION: Evade attacks with agile footwork. You can step forward, backwards, left, or right.

319.EXPLANATION: Taunt your enemy. Certain ability upgrades improve your taunts.
319.CONTROL_EXPLANATION: <Action:Battle_Extreme_Heat@Combat> when unarmed and facing nearby enemy

320.EXPLANATION: Move the camera up, down, left, or right. Change the controls in Options from the Pause Menu.

321.EXPLANATION: Set the camera behind the character.

322.EXPLANATION: Smoke in front of enemies to show them who's boss.

323.EXPLANATION: Perform a combo that can lead to a variety of other attacks. Transition to a Slash Kick by pressing <Action:Battle_Normal_Attack@Combat> three times and then mashing <Action:Battle_Normal_Attack@Combat>.

324.EXPLANATION: This powerful finish after a Rush Combo sends your enemy flying.

325.EXPLANATION: Attack without entering Fighting Stance to hit enemies at your sides and rear.

326.EXPLANATION: Attack with a front kick. This attack may change alongside walls and on stairs.

327.EXPLANATION: Punch your enemy after grabbing them. You can unleash a combo or send your enemy flying.

328.EXPLANATION: Throw an enemy after grabbing them. Use this attack to hurl an enemy into his comrades.

329.EXPLANATION: Take out an equipped weapon. Change weapons by selecting Items from the Pause Menu.

330.EXPLANATION: Pick up and throw weapons at enemies. The impact differs based on the weapon.

331.EXPLANATION: Smash an opponent against a wall. Grows more deadly the more you use it.

332.EXPLANATION: Crush an opponent from behind. Takes a bit of finesse to pull off.

333.EXPLANATION: Violently slam your enemy against a guard rail, then finish him off with a kick.

334.EXPLANATION: Race up a pole and use the height advantage to deliver a vicious kick.

335.EXPLANATION: Deliver a series of vicious kicks to an enemy you have slammed against a wall.

336.EXPLANATION: Use your Kali Sticks to rain blow after blow upon your opponent, rendering them helpless.

337.EXPLANATION: Callously hurl your enemy from dangerous heights. Can also be performed near rivers and similar locations.
337.CONTROL_EXPLANATION: <Color:109,193,240,255>Grab near high place or water, then<Color:Default> <Action:Battle_Heavy_Attack@Combat>

338.EXPLANATION: Slam your enemy's head into a raised surface, then deliver a vicious blow.

339.EXPLANATION: Elegantly grab a pole and use that momentum to crash down on an enemy.

340.EXPLANATION: Use a guard rail or fence to deliver a vicious blow to your enemy's backside.
340.CONTROL_EXPLANATION: <Color:109,193,240,255>Grab enemy at end of rail/fence, then<Color:Default> <Action:Battle_Heavy_Attack@Combat>

341.EXPLANATION: Drop an opponent on a protruding object. It's a real brain buster.

342.EXPLANATION: Viciously stomp on a fallen enemy. <Color:255,255,150,255>Only possible with weapons without a unique finishing move.<Color:Default>
342.CONTROL_EXPLANATION: <Action:Battle_Heavy_Attack@Combat> <Color:109,193,240,255>when armed and enemy falls face up<Color:Default>

343.EXPLANATION: Viciously kick a fallen enemy. <Color:255,255,150,255>Only possible with weapons without a unique finishing move.<Color:Default>
343.CONTROL_EXPLANATION: <Action:Battle_Heavy_Attack@Combat> <Color:109,193,240,255>when armed and enemy falls face down<Color:Default>

344.EXPLANATION: A simple and popular attack. Throw an object onto a downed enemy, putting the force of your body and soul behind it.

345.EXPLANATION: A devastating attack. Just when the enemy thinks you're finished, come down upon them with all your might.

346.EXPLANATION: Force something on an opponent's head and spin it. Then break them with a knifehand strike as though they were a pile of bricks.

347.EXPLANATION: Rattle an enemy's brains with a blow to the head, then finish him with a final blow.

348.EXPLANATION: Trap your opponent and send them flying. Makes use of powerful centrifugal force.

349.EXPLANATION: Pummel an enemy with a one-handed weapon, then deliver one mighty blow.

350.EXPLANATION: Drop something heavy on an enemy's head. Sometimes simple is best.

351.EXPLANATION: Charge an enemy with a short-bladed weapon and use your momentum to deliver a punishing strike.

352.EXPLANATION: Send enemies out of the park with a powerful swing.

353.EXPLANATION: Force a mystery liquid down an enemy's throat. Does more psychological damage than physical... Probably.

354.EXPLANATION: Shove the enemy away, then deliver three sword slashes.

355.EXPLANATION: Charge your stun gun with electrified passion, powering it up beyond its physical limits. Transcends modern understanding of physics.

356.EXPLANATION: Get a strike on your opponent's shins and bowl them into the gutter. Spare no mercy.

357.EXPLANATION: Rub salt into an enemy's eyes. Show your enemies what it truly means to be salty. Even works on those wearing glasses!

358.EXPLANATION: Inject a mysterious syringe into an opponent's posterior. Hopefully it isn't too dangerous.

359.EXPLANATION: Send an opponent flying down range. Not a fair way to play, but a nice shot nonetheless.

360.EXPLANATION: Grill an enemy's face with a gas burner. As simple as throwing a pie, and more painful than you can imagine.

361.EXPLANATION: Give your opponent a free tooth extraction or manicure, street style.

362.EXPLANATION: Use an umbrella's hooked handle to reel an enemy in and then cast them out.

363.EXPLANATION: An attack utilizing basic tonfa techniques.

364.EXPLANATION: Ram a bike into your enemy putting all your weight behind it.

365.EXPLANATION: Glue two enemies together with superglue, then watch them struggle before viciously tearing them apart.

366.EXPLANATION: Launch a skyrocket at your enemy.

367.EXPLANATION: Attack an enemy calling for backup, then smash his phone. No one's coming to save him now.
367.CONTROL_EXPLANATION: <Action:Battle_Heavy_Attack@Combat> <Color:109,193,240,255>when enemy tries to call for backup<Color:Default>

368.EXPLANATION: Use a long pole to launch your body high in the air and deliver a vicious attack.

369.EXPLANATION: After an ally smashes the back of your opponent's head into the ground with a powerbomb, cave in their face with a stomp.
369.CONTROL_EXPLANATION: <Action:Battle_Heavy_Attack@Combat> <Color:109,193,240,255>when ally is holding enemy from back<Color:Default>

370.EXPLANATION: A secret technique where you jump and knee the face of an enemy that was picked up and thrown.
370.CONTROL_EXPLANATION: <Action:Battle_Heavy_Attack@Combat> <Color:109,193,240,255>when ally is holding enemy from front<Color:Default>

371.EXPLANATION: Pin your opponent's hand to the wall with a dagger.

372.EXPLANATION: A graceful, majestic strike that uses nunchaku to their utmost potential.

373.EXPLANATION: Deliver a combo of assorted kicks. <Color:255,255,150,255>Only possible when the Climax Heat Gauge is full.<Color:Default>

374.EXPLANATION: Taunt enemies with the spirit of the white tiger to boost morale and increase your Heat Gauge.

375.EXPLANATION: Squat down and taunt a downed enemy.

376.EXPLANATION: Taunt an enemy you grabbed by glaring at him.

377.EXPLANATION: Taunt your enemy as you get up from the ground.

378.EXPLANATION: Earn more experience points when you finish off an enemy with Launch Strike.

379.EXPLANATION: Your attacks grow more powerful while you are drunk.

390.EXPLANATION: Knock enemies down by kicking the legs out from under them while rising to your feet.

391.EXPLANATION: Allows you to the break an enemy's guard with certain attacks.

392.EXPLANATION: Evade danger by performing Quickstep right after an attack. This will lower your Heat Gauge.

394.EXPLANATION: Boost the attack speed of the Rush Combo.

395.EXPLANATION: Take major evasive actions by performing Quickstep twice in a row.

396.EXPLANATION: Regain your footing when you are about to get knocked down, then perform a counterattack.
396.CONTROL_EXPLANATION: <Action:Battle_Heavy_Attack@Combat> right before you are knocked down

398.EXPLANATION: Enemies will be unable to guard against Launch Strike.

406.EXPLANATION: Regain your footing to avoid getting knocked down.

407.EXPLANATION: Do more damage to surrounding enemies when hitting them with thrown enemies.

605.CONTROL_EXPLANATION: <Action:Battle_Drop_Weapon@Combat> when next to head of downed enemy

606.EXPLANATION: Allows you to the break an enemy's guard with certain attacks.

607.EXPLANATION: Perform Quickstep twice in a row. An impressive dodge.

608.EXPLANATION: Slide into your enemy's legs at high speed.

609.EXPLANATION: Finish your enemy off after slamming him into a wall with My Meteor Tackle.
609.CONTROL_EXPLANATION: <Action:Battle_Heavy_Attack@Combat> after wall slam with My Meteor Tackle

610.EXPLANATION: Grab an enemy in the middle of a Rush Combo.

611.EXPLANATION: Throw an enemy who has grabbed on to you.

612.EXPLANATION: Parry your enemy's attack, then transition immediately to a grabbing counterattack.
612.CONTROL_EXPLANATION: <Action:Battle_Drop_Weapon@Combat> in Fighting Stance before attack hits

613.EXPLANATION: Break your enemy's guard when you attack with a one-handed weapon, knife, pole, or sword even if he is guarding with a weapon.

619.EXPLANATION: Throw enemies you grab with greater ease.

620.EXPLANATION: Do more damage to surrounding enemies when hitting them with thrown enemies.

622.EXPLANATION: Regain your footing to avoid getting knocked down.

623.EXPLANATION: Throw enemies you grab with even greater ease.

624.EXPLANATION: Further boost damage to surrounding enemies when hitting them with thrown enemies.

627.EXPLANATION: Extend the time you are invulnerable during Quickstep.

628.EXPLANATION: Reduce the amount that the Heat Gauge drops due to My Meteor Tackle.

633.EXPLANATION: Deliver a vicious strike, then steal your enemy's weapon. Does not work against certain weapons.

634.EXPLANATION: Boost the Heat Gauge's maximum value.

635.EXPLANATION: Stretch the enemy into a shape of a shachihoko, then grab him to deliver another strike.

636.EXPLANATION: Pass between your enemy's legs after My Meteor Tackle, then send him flying.

637.EXPLANATION: Boost the Heat Gauge's maximum value.

638.EXPLANATION: Leap from one enemy while attacking the rest with a sword.
638.CONTROL_EXPLANATION: <Color:109,193,240,255>Run between three enemies while wielding a sword, then<Color:Default> <Action:Battle_Heavy_Attack@Combat>

639.EXPLANATION: Mercilessly beat your enemy with a tonfa and deliver massive damage with each strike.

640.EXPLANATION: Immobilize your enemy with a pole weapon, then use the leverage you have to hurl him away.

641.EXPLANATION: Use your mastery of wrestling to perform one grappling move after another.

642.EXPLANATION: Violently hurl a long pole like a javelin at a distant enemy.
642.CONTROL_EXPLANATION: <Color:109,193,240,255>Equip pole, step away from enemy, then<Color:Default> <Action:Battle_Heavy_Attack@Combat>

643.EXPLANATION: Boost the amount the Heat Gauge rises when attacking.

644.EXPLANATION: Boost the Heat Gauge's maximum value.

648.EXPLANATION: Tackle your enemy, pushing him back. Can slam enemies into walls. Follow up with <Action:Battle_Normal_Attack@Combat> to knock down or <Action:Battle_Drop_Weapon@Combat> to push away.

650.EXPLANATION: Mow down enemies with a long pole. <Color:255,255,150,255>Only possible when the Climax Heat Gauge is full.<Color:Default>

651.EXPLANATION: Grab onto your enemy and do not let go until you deliver numerous blows.

653.EXPLANATION: Grab your enemy while evading his attack with Quickstep.

654.EXPLANATION: Throw your weapon at the enemy, catch it as it bounces, and repeat. <Color:255,255,150,255>Only possible when the Climax Heat Gauge is full.<Color:Default>

655.EXPLANATION: Torment your enemy with a series of thrusts, then finish him off with one more violent thrust.

656.EXPLANATION: Mastery of the dolly enables you to use it as a weapon by kicking it toward your enemies.

657.EXPLANATION: After mastering the use of beer crates, you can slam them over an enemy's head to blind them.

658.EXPLANATION: Mastery of the desk enables you to use it as a weapon by charging at your enemies with its legs facing forward.

659.EXPLANATION: Unlock the second level of health and use food to boost different abilities.

660.EXPLANATION: Boost Strength, Focus, and Fighting Spirit to the second level to achieve greater bonuses.

661.EXPLANATION: Lower the rate at which the second level of health automatically declines.

662.EXPLANATION: Boost the Heat Gauge's maximum value.

663.EXPLANATION: Boost the Heat Gauge's maximum value.

664.EXPLANATION: Boost the amount the Heat Gauge rises when attacking.
